title: Remove last usages of clone in Cache that aren't absolutely needed

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

body:
Turns out to only be useful internally for `channel_id_from_name`, but good for consistency and external usage.

## Changelog
- Removes member_field
- Changes guild_channels to return CacheRef
- Changes guild_roles to return CacheRef
- Changes message to return CacheRef
- Changes settings to return CacheRef
- Changes role to return CacheRef

title: Remove PrivateChannel from caching and events

labels.name: framework
labels.description: Related to the `framework` and `framework::standard` modules and/or the `command_attr` crate

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

body:
The entire `PrivateChannel` dashmap was never used, discord hasn't supplied events for it since API v8, and all the methods handling it were just unneeded. This allows for removal of `Channel` from a lot of the API surface, replacing it with the specific `GuildChannel` or specifically using `PrivateChannel`.

This was motivated by the `allow(clippy::large_enum_variant)` on `Channel` making me reconsider if it is strictly needed, which it is for a few endpoints (http get channel can return private channels), but was able to be removed from a lot of endpoints.

title: Remove duplicate channels map

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

body:
When a channel was received from the gateway it was cloned to be inserted into `cache.channels` and the `cache.guild.id.channels` maps, and since channels are the most cached model (around 7.3m channel models cached in my 230k server bot) this lead to a massive waste of memory (11.8gb of wasted ram in my extreme case).

This PR changes that map to only store the guild id that the channel originated from, which reduces ram usage by around half on my bot.

To accomplish this, I added in `CacheRefInner::MappedDashRef`, which stores a mapped dashmap ref, which in future can be used to remove the remaining `_field` methods.

I also took the liberty to remove the `category` methods that were cloning tons of channels and to implement using this method would cause massive cache contention for no real world use?

title: Enhance `parse_message_url` Function to Support Multiple Discord Domains
body:
### Overview

This pull request addresses issue #2508 by enhancing the `parse_message_url` function. The modification ensures that the function is capable of parsing message URLs across all Discord domains.

### Changes Made

- Refactored the function to make it more versatile and compatible with different domain formats.
- Updated the documentation to reflect the enhanced functionality.

### Related Issue

Closes: #2508


Please review and provide feedback.

---

Thank you!

title: feat:  Introduce `FormattedTimestamp` and `FormattedTimestampStyle` for improved message timestamp formatting
body:
### Overview

This PR introduces a new feature: the `FormattedTimestamp` struct and `FormattedTimestampStyle` enum. These additions provide a flexible way to represent and format timestamps in messages within the Serenity framework.

### Changes Made

- Added `FormattedTimestamp` struct to represent a combination of a timestamp and a formatting style.
- Introduced `FormattedTimestampStyle` enum to define various styles for formatting time in messages.
- Implemented relevant traits for ease of use, including `Clone`, `Copy`, `PartialEq`, `Eq`, `Debug`, `Hash`, `Display`, and parsing from strings.
- Included methods for creating instances, accessing timestamp and style, and displaying formatted time strings.

### Example Usage

#### Creating a FormattedTimestamp instance:

```rust
use your_crate_name::{FormattedTimestamp, FormattedTimestampStyle, Timestamp};

let timestamp = Timestamp::now();
let message_time = FormattedTimestamp::new(timestamp, Some(FormattedTimestampStyle::ShortDateTime));
```

#### Displaying formatted time string:

```rust
println!("{}", message_time); // Outputs: <t:timestamp:f>
```

#### Parsing from a string:

```rust
let time_str = "<t:timestamp:f>";
let parsed_time: Result<FormattedTimestamp, FormattedTimestampParseError> = time_str.parse();
```

### Related Issue

Closes: #2480  

### Tests

Included comprehensive tests covering the functionality of `FormattedTimestamp` and `FormattedTimestampStyle`.

### Additional Notes

This feature addresses the request raised in issue #2480, providing enhanced functionality for formatting timestamps in messages.

Please review and provide feedback.

---

Thank you!

title: Remove `PingInteraction::guild_locale` field

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

body: All `PING` interactions only happen when verifying an interaction endpoint (see [docs](https://discord.com/developers/docs/tutorials/upgrading-to-application-commands#adding-an-interactions-endpoint-url)). Since `PING` interactions don't happen in a guild, they don't have an associated `guild_id` field. Therefore, it makes no sense to also include a `guild_locale` field. Most likely, this field has always been `None`.

title: Add CreateAttachment.description and EditAttachment

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

body:
Summary: support attachment description, replace ad-hoc attachment edit methods with designated EditAttachments builder

Based on #2570

CreateAttachment is now Serialize and can be used for the `attachments` field directly, eliminating the extra `files` fields.

Attachment handling is now centralized in EditAttachments. This removes redundancy in serenity code and makes it more maintainable. Also, by modifying attachments through EditAttachments instead of ad-hoc methods on the builder itself, the side effects of adding attachments can now be documented much more clearly, as well as mirroring those side effects in the builder syntax (also see https://github.com/serenity-rs/serenity/pull/2570#discussion_r1373236965). The old ad-hoc methods are kept for backwards-compatibility, but marked deprecated

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

body:
To avoid future breakage, we shouldn't re-export functions from dependency libs in case a function signature changes, which would pass on breaking changes to serenity's users. Providing wrapper functions solves this issue.

Note: changed `from_str`to take `&str` instead of `String`, and simply clone it for the `simd_json` case. This means the more common `serde_json` use case no longer requires ownership (or an extra clone before passing the string in).

labels.name: breaking change

For select menus not of type `String`, the `default_values` json field allows for autofilled values to be populated. Therefore, fields have been added to the corresponding `CreateSelectMenuKind` enum variants to support this.

I'd like feedback, specifically for `Mentionable`. Should there be separate arrays for default UserIds and RoleIds, or should there just be a single array of GenericIds? This would allow for more controlled ordering e.g. interleaving users and roles in the list.

I've tested that this works, but for some reason if `default_values` is populated, the client has a 5 second delay to render the select menu. Can anyone else confirm this? Unsure what could be causing it, as the time to response from the API remains normal with the field populated.

title: Make icon and unicode_emoji nullable in addition to optional

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

body:
With this PR it is now possible to properly clear a role's icon/unicode_emoji.

### The problem
In both `serenity/current` and `serenity/next` all `EditRole` fields are skipped when they are `None`. This does not work for `EditRole::icon` and `EditRole::unicode_emoji` because the field being `undefined` is different from the field being `null` at the API[^1]: if the field is `undefined` it will be kept unchanged, and if it is `null` it will be cleared. 

The existing code then doesn't actually clear the icon/unicode_emoji when setting the other, but simply keeps it unchanged. 

### The solution
With a double Option it is possible to distinguish `undefined` from `null` from a set value. This is the [canonical](https://github.com/serde-rs/serde/issues/984#issuecomment-314143738) solution using serde (the example shows de-serialization but it works the same in reverse).

Then, `None` is "keep field unchanged", `Some(None)` is "clear this field" and `Some(Some(value)` is "set this field to this value"

### API breaks
- `EditRole::unicode_emoji()` takes a `Option<String>` instead of `impl Into<String>`.
- `EditRole::icon()` takes a `Option<&CreateAttachment>` instead of `&CreateAttachment`

### Verified
* `EditRole::icon(Some(...))` sets the icon and clears the Unicode emoji. 
* `EditRole::icon(None)` clears both icon and Unicode emoji.
* `EditRole::unicode_emoji(Some(...))` sets the Unicode emoji and clears the icon.
* `EditRole::unicode_emoji(None)` clears both Unicode emoji and icon.
* `cargo +nightly fmt --all` and `cargo test --all` pass.

### Other stuff
For more control it would be possible now to remove the automatic clearing of the unicode_emoji/icon in `icon()`/`unicode_emoji()`, but I didn't see any real use-cases for this.

[^1]: "All parameters to this endpoint are optional and nullable." - https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/guild#modify-guild-role

body:

title: Bump bitflags to 2.x

labels.name: voice
labels.description: Related to the `voice` module and `serenity_voice_model` crate.

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

body:
In bitflags 2.x, bitflag structs changed to tuple structs and can't be instantiated the same way as before. Unfortunately, performing bitops on them isn't possible in `const` contexts, so a workaround is to perform them on the raw `.bits()` and pass the result to `from_bits_truncate`.

Also, bitflag structs no longer automatically derive the following traits: `Clone`, `Copy`, `Debug`, `Default`, `Hash`, `PartialEq`, `Eq`, `PartialOrd`, and `Ord`. To avoid breaking backcompat, I added them back, but serenity does not rely on all of them. Nothing relies on `PartialOrd`/`Ord`, and only the `Permissions` and `SpeakingState` types rely on `Hash`/`PartialEq`/`Eq`. The common required traits are just `Copy`/`Clone` and `Debug`. It's worth considering if we should remove extra impls for types which we expect won't ever make use of them in user code.

title: Bump dependency versions

labels.name: voice
labels.description: Related to the `voice` module and `serenity_voice_model` crate.

body:
* simd-json 0.7 -> 0.10
* tokio-tungstenite 0.19 -> 0.20
* ed25519-dalek 1.0 -> 2.0
* criterion 0.4 -> 0.5
* notify 5.0.0-pre.14 -> 6.1

In tungstenite 0.20, the `WebSocketConfig::max_send_queue` is deprecated for `max_write_buffer_length`. The default value corresponds to an unlimited length, same as before. However, there's a new `write_buffer_length` field which controls how much buffering is done before a flush occurs and the buffer gets written to the underlying system. It defaults to 128KiB (so 128 * 1024) - is this a fine value for us to use?

* Move `utils::check_overflow` into the `builder` module.
* Change the feature gate on `ReactionType::data` from `model` to `http`, and un-gate its other methods.
* Change the feature gate on `GuildInfo::icon_url` to just `model`.
* Some miscellaneous other feature gate changes to imports and the like

in the discord api [Interaction Callback Type](https://discord.com/developers/docs/interactions/receiving-and-responding#interaction-response-object-interaction-callback-type)
with value`7` we can update the message the components belong to as a interaction response, but currently under the [MessageComponentInteraction](https://docs.rs/serenity/latest/serenity/model/prelude/prelude/interaction/message_component/struct.MessageComponentInteraction.html#) there's only methods related to defer, reponse and follow-up

So i tried to add it myself, basically the same but specify the `.kind(InteractionResponseType::UpdateMessage)` 
it does work but I'm not sure should it using the same `CreateInteractionResponse` struct, 
although it's editing a message but for discord server it should be the same.

thanks for reading

title: Support creating standalone public threads
body:
Discord's API has two endpoints for creating threads: one for [creating a thread as a reply to a message](https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#start-thread-from-message) and one for [creating a thread that's not connected to any existing message](https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#start-thread-without-message). The former only supports creating public threads, but the latter supports both public and private threads. However, serenity did not allow creating public standalone threads. This PR fills that gap, and renames the methods for calling these endpoints to more accurately describe what they do.

When I brought up the missing functionality in the #serenity channel, @arqunis claimed that the “start thread without message” endpoint was only for private threads, pointing to this part of the documentation:

> \* `type` currently defaults to `PRIVATE_THREAD` in order to match the behavior when thread documentation was first published. In a future API version this will be changed to be a required field, with no default.

I believe that this is a misunderstanding of the docs. They say “defaults to `PRIVATE_THREAD`”, not “must be `PRIVATE_THREAD`”. I also tested calling the endpoint manually with `type` set to `PUBLIC_THREAD` and it works as expected.

title: Deserialize to ArrayString instead of String for ImageHash
body:
This saves an allocation on creation of `ImageHash`, but adds a new dependency that is not currently in the dep tree at all.

I chose the `arrayvec` crate over `smallvec`, `tinyvec`, or `heapless` as:
- `smallvec` will fall over to heap allocation if length exceeds the capacity
- `tinyvec` and `smallvec` does not include an `ArrayString`
- `heapless` contains a lot of unnecessary data structures that may bloat compile time

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

body:
Implements it ~the same as `create_message` already did.

Fixes #2463.

title: Optimise size of model structs

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

body: This PR reduces the sizes of many integer fields, or converts data to enums when appropriate.

title: Add dedicated type for storing image hashes

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

body: This converts the hex representation that is used across the API into a much smaller (56 vs 17) type which improves type safety, saves space, and reduces heap allocations (only during a clone, but deserialization could be made work without an allocation if we pull in an ArrayString dependency).

title: Use secrecy::SecretString instead of manual debug implementation

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

body: This fixes some mismatches between Debug implementations and the underlying struct, which were caught by `clippy::missing_fields_in_debug`. This PR also means that webhook/bot tokens are going to be zeroed when dropped, as a security measure.

title: Use ShardId everywhere

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

body: Fixes the type mismatch causing a load of manual ShardId constructions, which go against the point of type safety.

title: Replace `once_cell::sync::OnceCell` with `std::sync::OnceLock`

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

body: Newly stabilized in 1.70. Allows us to remove `once_cell` as a dependency.

title: Turn generic params with `IntoIterator` bounds into `impl IntoIterator`

labels.name: framework
labels.description: Related to the `framework` and `framework::standard` modules and/or the `command_attr` crate

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

body: Users should never need to specify the concrete type on an `IntoIterator` bound. I think this technically isn't a breaking change, but targeting `current` would mean dealing with a nightmare of merge conflicts on `next`, so I picked some low hanging fruit instead.

title: Add a way to remove all attachments easily
Include all Message fields in MessageUpdateEvent

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

body:
I previously had commented some out in https://github.com/serenity-rs/serenity/pull/2393/files#diff-ae030146ad938ad8598138dec5f70cd4a4d3df75907295fc933f3d281a54430dL423-L448 because they cannot change in message update events. But unbeknownst to me, Discord doesn't send only the changed fields, but it sends some fields even when they didn't change.

The safer thing is to have just every single field of Message's fields also in MessageUpdateEvent

@GnomedDev Reported this deserialization error: `[serenity::gateway::ws]: Err deserializing text: SimdJson(Error { index: 0, character: None, error: Serde("Serde("missing field joined_at") at character 0") }); text: {"t":"GUILD_UPDATE"`

title: Clean up `serenity::model::prelude`

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

body:
Cleans up the model prelude by removing some re-exports, namely:

- Don't re-export all the submodules of `model`
- Don't re-export 3rd party types that are only used internally
- Define the `Color` type alias in `model::colour`
- Clean up collisions around `automod::EventType` by not glob-exporting from `guild::automod::*`

Note that `guild::audit_log` and `guild::automod` still end up getting re-exported via `guild::*`, but I'm not sure how to address that without manually re-exporting each type from `guild`, which would be annoying.
